item.title: Unmade up grass verge with large hole. Recently laid tarmac left with uneven ridge, 20th August
item.description:
This problem has been here for several months. It originated when a large oak was removed. You can still see the white arrow chalked on the pavement where work was to be carried out. The area was never flattened. A small section of tarmac was laid but a deep edge has been left. Easy to catch your foot and trip. This area of pavement is used frequently by people crossing over from the station. It is the first driveway access from Copers Cope Road and pedestrians seem to aim for this away from Brackley Road mgrass verges. At night this area is extremely dark as there is no immediate lighting. I donâ€™t think it will be long before someone trips over the bad surface.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brackley Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Door Lock to Bletchley Court, 20th August
item.description:
The main door into Bletchley Court is not locking so anyone can walk in. You usually get in by key fob but the sensor is not working or there is another issue, if it can be looked at, please? Also, someone has urinated in the stairwell.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wenlock Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
